page.title: 04ART AND CRAFT
page.content: The National Trust asked Mrs. Porteous to leave their shop in Alva to open one in Culross. They said they would give her one of their derelict properties on condition that she restore it. It was not easy. The architect died in the middle of it;she had problems with the builder. Now, the Tron Shop is very busy, especially in summer. Locals as well as tourists buy the jewellery, pottery, musical instruments and clothing, all Scottish made, and the Irish linen teatowels. Just over a month ago a second shop to attract tourists opened,THE CURIOSITY SHOP.It specialises in antiques and sells plants too.
